channel.title: Best Practice on A coders, hackers heaven.....Hm...I do not think so...
channel.description: Recent content in Best Practice on A coders, hackers heaven.....Hm...I do not think so...

item.title: FluentAPI - Usage
item.description: As a Java developer I always got the impression that my own code can be made better (unfortunately I am not perfect). That brought me to think about how I could improve the code. So I thought several times about my code and while looking for example into my unit/integrations tests I found the following code snippet: AccessRules rules = new AccessRules(); AccessRule rule1 = new AccessRule("/"); rule1.add(UserFactory.createInstance("*"), AccessLevel.READ); rule1.add(UserFactory.createInstance("harry"), AccessLevel.
